name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: But why o why do you assume there is a trade-off between a job guarantee and a UBI? I support both at once. And there is NO reason we cannot have both at once. That way neither the state nor the capitalist can impose a job on the needy.

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: ‘The Austerity Doctrine in the Time of Coronavirus’. Read a pertinent Q&A on post-pandemic austerity and then watch last night's discussion between regulars Brian Eno & Yanis Varoufakis and very special guests Stephanie Kelton & Naomi Klein  https://t.co/TrFCz4TUta

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: Όπως η "εκπαιδευτική μεταρρύθμιση" γίνεται κόντρα στους δάσκαλους, και η "στήριξη του ΕΣΥ" γίνεται κόντρα - και χωρίς καν τον διάλογο με τους γιατρούς - έτσι και τη Δικαιοσύνη η κυβέρνηση Μητσοτάκη την "μεταρρυθμίζει" κόντρα στους δικαστές...  https://t.co/4UCWqpTKWp via @YouTube

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: Of course they are. There is no either or. UBI and free provision of public goods go hand-in-hand. And don't forget that the period of greatest wage growth was also the period when public health and public education were strengthened.

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: The whole point of UBI is that, because everyone receives it unconditionally, no one becomes welfare dependent - i.e. you will not lose it if you get a great new job. After all, no one worries that unearned income shrinks Bezos' will to work/innovate. Why worry that UBI might?

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: Thanks for ploughing through my 'thriller'. I was fortunate enough to experience a morality tale pertinent to all our countries. As for my 'plight', worry not for me. I am privileged. It is the most vulnerable in our societies that we need to support and worry about.

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: Regarding Ecuador, my friend Jeremy Corbyn tweeted: "So sorry at result... As Neruda said you cannot stop the coming of spring!" Except that they CAN stop the coming of spring. They did it in Chile in 1973. And they did it again in Greece in 2015. Victory is never guaranteed!

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: Nope! The 29 billion I was going to default on were bonds purchased in 2010-1 under J.C. Trichet (under the SMP program). The 33 billion worth mentioned here are fresh ones, issued in the last few years, and purchased under Draghi-Lagarde's QE. GR -> Deeper & deeper in the RED!

name: Yanis Varoufakis
tweet: Μου τα έλεγε και κατ' ιδίαν. Μόνο που με το που μπαίναμε στα Eurogroup κάτι πάθαινε το παιδί και είτε κατάπινε τη γλώσσα του είτε, όπως στην Ρίγα, έλεγε τα αντίθετα. Ελεεινός doublespeak practitioner - όπως κι οι Ντράγκι, Μοσκοβισί και Σια...
